questionText: Which compiler error does this code produce?
questionCode:
struct Color { red: u8, green: u8, blue: u8 }
  let c = Color { red: 0, green: 128, alpha: 255 }
options: A. Missing field `blue` in initializer of `Color`
errorMessage:
error[E0609]: no field `alpha` on type `Color`
  --> src/main.rs:6:30
   |
6 |     let c = Color { red: 0, green: 128, alpha: 255 };
   |                             -----  ^^^^^ help: a field with a similar name exists: `blue`
solutionPrompt: Which of the following changes will fix the error? (Select all that apply)
solutionOptions: let c = Color { red: 0, green: 128, blue: 255 };
Add `alpha: u8` to the struct definition: struct Color { red: u8, green: u8, blue: u8, alpha: u8 }
